title: 105_hr2949
content: MISSOURI AND MIDDLE MISSISSIPPI RIVERS ENHANCEMENT PROJECT. The definitions in this section include the Middle Mississippi River from the mouth of the Ohio River to the mouth of the Missouri River, the Missouri River from its mouth to river mile 742, the project authorized, and the Secretary of the Army. The project authorized by this section refers to a plan developed by the Secretary of the Army to protect and enhance fish and wildlife habitat of the Missouri River and the middle Mississippi River within 180 days of the Act's enactment. The plan shall include activities to protect and enhance fish and wildlife habitat in the Missouri River and middle Mississippi River region, while considering water-related needs like flood control and navigation. The plan shall include modification and improvement of navigation training structures to protect and enhance fish and wildlife habitat, as well as the creation of side channels for the same purpose. The plan includes modification and creation of side channels, island, and riverine fish and wildlife habitat, with criteria for prioritizing activities based on cost-effectiveness. The plan involves prioritizing activities based on cost-effectiveness and success likelihood, as well as physical and biological monitoring for project evaluation. Implementation of activities will be carried out using allocated funds by the Secretary. The Secretary will design and construct project features using allocated funds to accelerate completion of activities. The design and construction will accelerate activities to protect and enhance fish and wildlife habitat of the Missouri River or the middle Mississippi River, and be compatible with project purposes. The Secretary shall integrate these activities with other Federal and State activities. The Secretary will integrate activities with other Federal and State activities, without affecting existing authority for the mitigation project authorized by the Water Resources Development Act of 1986. Nebraska is authorized by various sections of the Water Resources Development Act of 1986, without conferring any new regulatory authority. The Secretary shall provide for public review and comment in developing and carrying out the plan under subsection (b) and activities described in subsection (c), in accordance with applicable Federal law. This section does not confer any new regulatory authority on any entity. The Secretary must comply with applicable Federal laws, including providing advance notice of meetings, allowing public input, maintaining records, and cost sharing with a non-Federal share not exceeding 25 percent for project costs. The project cost limit is 25 percent, with a Federal share cap of $5,000,000 per activity. Federal responsibility for project operation and maintenance. Authorization of $50,000,000 for activities from 1999 to 2004. The Federal government will provide $50,000,000 for activities from 1999 to 2004, managed by the Mississippi Valley Division of the Army Corps of Engineers.
